content: double-thick cuff hat a knitting pattern by staci perry www verypink com ​ getting started sizes small/medium and medium/large the cuff is very stretchy s/m will fit most women and m/l will fit most ​​ men needles size us 6 4 0mm 16 circulars a second set of circulars in any length in the same size or smaller us 6 ​​ double-pointed needles yarn 2 colors of dk weight yarn 50 grams each color details on the yarn i used below ​​ additional materials five ring stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving ends ​​ gauge 6 stitches per inch ​​ the yarn i used knit picks capra in magnolia and blush the yarn i used in the worsted-weight hat is knit picks wool of the andes tweed in papaya heather and oyster heather abbreviations co - cast-on dpns - double pointed needles k - knit k2tog - knit two stitches together p - purl pm - place marker ssk - slip slip knit decrease video links part 1 intro https //youtu be/sz-o1c_8-va ​​ part 2 knitting double cuff https //youtu be/sz-o1c_8-va t=157 ​​ part 3 switching to dpns and adding pompoms https //youtu be/sz-o1c_8-va t=780 ​​ directions in the directions below if two numbers appear the first number is for the smaller size the second number is for the larger size double cuff using a crocheted provisional cast-on and scrap yarn co 104 116 stitches using your cuff color and starting at the slip knot end knit across these stitches place marker and join in the round and work k2 p2 rib until piece measures 4 5 12cm this was 32 rounds for me break cuff color unzip the provisional cast-on to your second circular needle and fold the cuff in half as demonstrated in the video using second color knit one together from the front needle with one together from the back needle until all of the stitches are joined knit every round until entire piece measures 7 18cm crown decreases smaller size setup round 1 k 20 pm *k 21 pm* repeat between *s to end of round round 2 k to two stitches before marker k2tog *ssk k to two stitches before marker k2tog* repeat between *s to end of round 95 stitches 19 stitches between each marker round 3 knit continue with both sizes below larger size setup round 1 ssk k 22 pm *k 23 pm* repeat between *s to end of round 115 stitches 23 stitches between each marker round 2 knit continue with both sizes below both sizes switch to dpns when there are too few stitches to fit around your needles i switched to dpns at 55 stitches 11 stitches between each marker round 1 *ssk k to two stitches before marker k2tog* repeat between *s to end of round 10 stitches decreased round 2 knit repeat these two rounds 8 10 times 16 20 rounds total 15 stitches remain 3 stitches between each of the markers next round k3tog around removing
